1â†’# Tasks: Bootstrap Fixpoint Achievement
     2â†’
     3â†’**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/001-bootstrap-fixpoint/`
     4â†’**Prerequisites**: plan.md (required), spec.md (required for user stories), research.md, data-model.md, contracts/
     5â†’
     6â†’**Tests**: TDD required per Constitution Principle VII. Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation.
     7â†’
     8â†’**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing of each story.
     9â†’
    10â†’## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`
    11â†’
    12â†’- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
    13â†’- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (e.g., US1, US2, US3, US4)
    14â†’- Include exact file paths in descriptions
    15â†’
    16â†’## Path Conventions
    17â†’
    18â†’- **Host compiler**: `src/clysm/` (Common Lisp)
    19â†’- **Runtime scripts**: `host-shim/` (JavaScript/Node.js)
    20â†’- **Build scripts**: `build/` (Common Lisp entry points)
    21â†’- **Shell scripts**: `scripts/` (Bash)
    22â†’- **Tests**: `tests/` (contract/, integration/, unit/)
    23â†’- **Output**: `dist/` (Wasm binaries, reports)
    24â†’
    25â†’---
    26â†’
    27â†’## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure)
    28â†’
    29â†’**Purpose**: Verify prerequisites and establish test infrastructure
    30â†’
    31â†’- [x] T001 Verify prerequisites: SBCL 2.4+, Node.js 20+, wasm-tools installed
    32â†’- [x] T002 [P] Verify dist/clysm-stage1.wasm exists and is valid (wasm-tools validate)
    33â†’- [x] T003 [P] Verify host-shim/io-shim.js and host-shim/fs-shim.js are functional
    34â†’- [x] T004 Create tests/contract/fixpoint/ directory for contract tests
    35â†’- [x] T005 Create tests/integration/bootstrap/ directory for integration tests
    36â†’
    37â†’---
    38â†’
    39â†’## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)
    40â†’
    41â†’**Purpose**: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before ANY user story can be implemented
    42â†’
    43â†’**âš ï¸ CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete
    44â†’
    45â†’- [x] T006 Read and understand src/clysm/stage0/exports.lisp export registry pattern
    46â†’- [x] T007 Read and understand src/clysm/stage1/generator.lisp stub module creation
    47â†’- [x] T008 [P] Document current Stage 1 exports by running: wasm-tools print dist/clysm-stage1.wasm | grep export
    48â†’- [x] T009 Identify function index allocation: FFI imports at 0-3, user exports at 4+
    49â†’
    50â†’**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin
    51â†’
    52â†’---
    53â†’
    54â†’## Phase 3: User Story 1 & 4 - Stage 1 Compiler Export + Blocker Reporting (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP
    55â†’
    56â†’**Goal**: Export compile_form from Stage 1 and implement blocker categorization for failed compilations
    57â†’
    58â†’**Independent Test**: Load Stage 1 in Node.js, query exports, invoke compile_form with `(+ 1 2)`, verify valid Wasm output
    59â†’
    60â†’### Tests for User Story 1 & 4 (TDD Required)
    61â†’
    62â†’> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**
    63â†’
    64â†’- [x] T010 [P] [US1] Contract test: Stage 1 exports compile_form in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-exports.lisp
    65â†’- [x] T011 [P] [US1] Contract test: compile_form signature (anyref -> anyref) in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-signature.lisp
    66â†’- [x] T012 [P] [US4] Contract test: blocker report JSON schema validation in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-blocker-report.lisp
    67â†’- [x] T013 [US1] Integration test: compile simple form `(+ 1 2)` in tests/integration/bootstrap/test-compile-simple.js
    68â†’
    69â†’### Implementation for User Story 1
    70â†’
    71â†’- [x] T014 [US1] Modify src/clysm/stage1/generator.lisp to call generate-exports() from stage0
    72â†’- [x] T015 [US1] Update export-section generation to include compile_form at index 4
    73â†’- [x] T016 [US1] Update export-section generation to include compile_all at index 5
    74â†’- [x] T017 [US1] Update export-section generation to include _initialize at index 6
    75â†’- [x] T018 [US1] Wire compile_form export to bundled compiler function implementation
    76â†’- [x] T019 [US1] Regenerate Stage 1: sbcl --load build/stage1-complete.lisp
    77â†’- [x] T020 [US1] Verify exports: wasm-tools print dist/clysm-stage1.wasm | grep 'export.*compile_form'
    78â†’- [x] T021 [US1] Update host-shim/stage1-runner.js to detect and report available exports
    79â†’
    80â†’### Implementation for User Story 4 (Blocker Reporting)
    81â†’
    82â†’- [ ] T022 [P] [US4] Create BlockerCategory struct in src/clysm/stage1/blocker.lisp
    83â†’- [ ] T023 [P] [US4] Create BlockerReport struct in src/clysm/stage1/blocker.lisp
    84â†’- [ ] T024 [US4] Implement categorize-error function to classify compilation failures
    85â†’- [ ] T025 [US4] Implement aggregate-blockers function to group failures by category
    86â†’- [ ] T026 [US4] Implement generate-blocker-report function with JSON output
    87â†’- [ ] T027 [US4] Add remediation suggestions map in src/clysm/stage1/blocker.lisp
    88â†’- [ ] T028 [US4] Integrate blocker reporting into Stage 1 compilation pipeline
    89â†’
    90â†’**Checkpoint**: Stage 1 exports compile_form, blocker reports are categorized. Run T010-T013 tests to verify.
    91â†’
    92â†’---
    93â†’
    94â†’## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Stage 2 Generation (Priority: P2)
    95â†’
    96â†’**Goal**: Use Stage 1's compile_form to compile Clysm source into Stage 2 Wasm binary
    97â†’
    98â†’**Independent Test**: Run stage2-gen.js, verify dist/clysm-stage2.wasm is created and passes validation
    99â†’
   100â†’### Tests for User Story 2 (TDD Required)
   101â†’
   102â†’- [ ] T029 [P] [US2] Contract test: Stage 2 generation script exits with code 0/1/2 in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-stage2-exit.js
   103â†’- [ ] T030 [P] [US2] Contract test: Stage 2 output passes wasm-tools validate in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-stage2-valid.js
   104â†’- [ ] T031 [US2] Integration test: full Stage 2 generation in tests/integration/bootstrap/test-stage2-gen.js
   105â†’
   106â†’### Implementation for User Story 2
   107â†’
   108â†’- [ ] T032 [US2] Create host-shim/stage2-gen.js with Stage 1 loader
   109â†’- [ ] T033 [US2] Implement source file discovery (src/clysm/**/*.lisp in dependency order)
   110â†’- [ ] T034 [US2] Implement form parser to extract defun/defmacro/defstruct forms
   111â†’- [ ] T035 [US2] Implement compile_form invocation loop with error capture
   112â†’- [ ] T036 [US2] Implement Wasm module aggregator to combine compiled forms
   113â†’- [ ] T037 [US2] Add compilation statistics tracking (success/fail counts)
   114â†’- [ ] T038 [US2] Generate dist/stage2-report.json with compilation results
   115â†’- [ ] T039 [US2] Create scripts/run-stage2-gen.sh wrapper script
   116â†’- [ ] T040 [US2] Verify Stage 2 output: wasm-tools validate dist/clysm-stage2.wasm
   117â†’
   118â†’**Checkpoint**: Stage 2 generation completes (even with partial compilation). Run T029-T031 tests to verify.
   119â†’
   120â†’---
   121â†’
   122â†’## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Fixpoint Verification (Priority: P3)
   123â†’
   124â†’**Goal**: Compare Stage 1 and Stage 2 for byte-identical match, report detailed diff if not
   125â†’
   126â†’**Independent Test**: Run verify-fixpoint.sh with both binaries, get pass/fail result with diff details
   127â†’
   128â†’### Tests for User Story 3 (TDD Required)
   129â†’
   130â†’- [ ] T041 [P] [US3] Contract test: fixpoint script exit codes (0=identical, 1=differ) in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-fixpoint-exit.js
   131â†’- [ ] T042 [P] [US3] Contract test: diff output format validation in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-diff-format.js
   132â†’- [ ] T043 [US3] Integration test: full fixpoint verification in tests/integration/bootstrap/test-fixpoint.sh
   133â†’
   134â†’### Implementation for User Story 3
   135â†’
   136â†’- [ ] T044 [US3] Enhance scripts/verify-fixpoint.sh with size comparison
   137â†’- [ ] T045 [US3] Add byte-level comparison using cmp command
   138â†’- [ ] T046 [US3] Implement first-difference-offset reporting
   139â†’- [ ] T047 [US3] Add section-level diff using wasm-tools objdump
   140â†’- [ ] T048 [US3] Create FixpointResult JSON output format
   141â†’- [ ] T049 [US3] Add --json flag for CI-friendly output
   142â†’- [ ] T050 [US3] Handle edge cases: missing files, empty files, permission errors
   143â†’
   144â†’**Checkpoint**: Fixpoint verification produces actionable comparison result. Run T041-T043 tests to verify.
   145â†’
   146â†’---
   147â†’
   148â†’## Phase 6: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns
   149â†’
   150â†’**Purpose**: Improvements that affect multiple user stories
   151â†’
   152â†’- [ ] T051 [P] Update CLAUDE.md with new commands and current status
   153â†’- [ ] T052 [P] Add Phase 13D-9 entry to docs/features/COMPLETED-FEATURES.md
   154â†’- [ ] T053 Run nix flake check to verify build integrity
   155â†’- [ ] T054 [P] Add CI workflow step for fixpoint verification in .github/workflows/ (if exists)
   156â†’- [ ] T055 Run quickstart.md validation end-to-end
   157â†’- [ ] T056 [P] Cleanup: remove debug logging from production code
   158â†’- [ ] T057 Final verification: regenerate Stage 1, generate Stage 2, run fixpoint check
   159â†’
   160â†’---
   161â†’
   162â†’## Dependencies & Execution Order
   163â†’
   164â†’### Phase Dependencies
   165â†’
   166â†’- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
   167â†’- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup completion - BLOCKS all user stories
   168â†’- **User Stories 1 & 4 (Phase 3)**: Depends on Foundational - MVP milestone
   169â†’- **User Story 2 (Phase 4)**: Depends on Phase 3 (needs compile_form export)
   170â†’- **User Story 3 (Phase 5)**: Depends on Phase 4 (needs Stage 2 binary)
   171â†’- **Polish (Phase 6)**: Depends on all user stories being complete
   172â†’
   173â†’### User Story Dependencies
   174â†’
   175â†’```
   176â†’Phase 2 (Foundational)
   177â†’        â”‚
   178â†’        â–¼
   179â†’Phase 3: US1 + US4 (Stage 1 Export + Blocker Reporting) â”€â”€â”
   180â†’        â”‚                                                   â”‚
   181â†’        â–¼                                                   â”‚
   182â†’Phase 4: US2 (Stage 2 Generation) â—„â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   183â†’        â”‚                         (needs compile_form from US1)
   184â†’        â–¼
   185â†’Phase 5: US3 (Fixpoint Verification)
   186â†’        â”‚   (needs Stage 2 from US2)
   187â†’        â–¼
   188â†’Phase 6: Polish
   189â†’```
   190â†’
   191â†’### Within Each User Story
   192â†’
   193â†’1. Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation (TDD)
   194â†’2. Contract tests before integration tests
   195â†’3. Core implementation before integration points
   196â†’4. Verification command before moving to next phase
   197â†’
   198â†’### Parallel Opportunities
   199â†’
   200â†’**Phase 1 (Setup)**:
   201â†’- T002 and T003 can run in parallel
   202â†’
   203â†’**Phase 3 (US1 + US4)**:
   204â†’- T010, T011, T012 can run in parallel (different test files)
   205â†’- T022, T023 can run in parallel (different structs)
   206â†’
   207â†’**Phase 4 (US2)**:
   208â†’- T029, T030 can run in parallel (different test files)
   209â†’
   210â†’**Phase 5 (US3)**:
   211â†’- T041, T042 can run in parallel (different test files)
   212â†’
   213â†’**Phase 6 (Polish)**:
   214â†’- T051, T052, T054, T056 can run in parallel (different files)
   215â†’
   216â†’---
   217â†’
   218â†’## Parallel Example: Phase 3 Tests
   219â†’
   220â†’```bash
   221â†’# Launch all contract tests for US1 + US4 together:
   222â†’Task: "Contract test: Stage 1 exports compile_form in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-exports.lisp"
   223â†’Task: "Contract test: compile_form signature in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-signature.lisp"
   224â†’Task: "Contract test: blocker report JSON schema in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-blocker-report.lisp"
   225â†’```
   226â†’
   227â†’---
   228â†’
   229â†’## Implementation Strategy
   230â†’
   231â†’### MVP First (User Stories 1 & 4 Only)
   232â†’
   233â†’1. Complete Phase 1: Setup
   234â†’2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (CRITICAL - blocks all stories)
   235â†’3. Complete Phase 3: User Stories 1 & 4
   236â†’4. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Test compile_form export independently
   237â†’5. Deploy/demo if ready - can already show compiler export capability
   238â†’
   239â†’### Incremental Delivery
   240â†’
   241â†’1. Complete Setup + Foundational â†’ Foundation ready
   242â†’2. Add US1 + US4 â†’ Test independently â†’ **MVP: Compiler Export + Blocker Reports**
   243â†’3. Add US2 â†’ Test independently â†’ **Self-hosting demo: Stage 2 generation**
   244â†’4. Add US3 â†’ Test independently â†’ **Full feature: Fixpoint verification**
   245â†’5. Each phase adds value without breaking previous phases
   246â†’
   247â†’### Expected Outcomes by Phase
   248â†’
   249â†’| Phase | Deliverable | Verification |
   250â†’|-------|-------------|--------------|
   251â†’| Phase 3 | compile_form exported | `wasm-tools print \| grep compile_form` |
   252â†’| Phase 4 | Stage 2 binary | `wasm-tools validate dist/clysm-stage2.wasm` |
   253â†’| Phase 5 | Fixpoint result | `./scripts/verify-fixpoint.sh` exits 0 or 1 |
   254â†’| Phase 6 | Documentation | All tests pass, quickstart works |
   255â†’
   256â†’---
   257â†’
   258â†’## Notes
   259â†’
   260â†’- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
   261â†’- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
   262â†’- TDD is mandatory per Constitution Principle VII
   263â†’- Each phase checkpoint verifies story independently
   264â†’- Commit after each task or logical group
   265â†’- Stop at any checkpoint to validate story independently
   266â†’- Current compilation rate: 14.2% - expect many blocker reports initially
   267â†’

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
# Tasks: Bootstrap Fixpoint Achievement

**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/001-bootstrap-fixpoint/`
**Prerequisites**: plan.md (required), spec.md (required for user stories), research.md, data-model.md, contracts/

**Tests**: TDD required per Constitution Principle VII. Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation.

**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing of each story.

## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`

- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (e.g., US1, US2, US3, US4)
- Include exact file paths in descriptions

## Path Conventions

- **Host compiler**: `src/clysm/` (Common Lisp)
- **Runtime scripts**: `host-shim/` (JavaScript/Node.js)
- **Build scripts**: `build/` (Common Lisp entry points)
- **Shell scripts**: `scripts/` (Bash)
- **Tests**: `tests/` (contract/, integration/, unit/)
- **Output**: `dist/` (Wasm binaries, reports)

---

## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure)

**Purpose**: Verify prerequisites and establish test infrastructure

- [x] T001 Verify prerequisites: SBCL 2.4+, Node.js 20+, wasm-tools installed
- [x] T002 [P] Verify dist/clysm-stage1.wasm exists and is valid (wasm-tools validate)
- [x] T003 [P] Verify host-shim/io-shim.js and host-shim/fs-shim.js are functional
- [x] T004 Create tests/contract/fixpoint/ directory for contract tests
- [x] T005 Create tests/integration/bootstrap/ directory for integration tests

---

## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

**Purpose**: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before ANY user story can be implemented

**âš ï¸ CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete

- [x] T006 Read and understand src/clysm/stage0/exports.lisp export registry pattern
- [x] T007 Read and understand src/clysm/stage1/generator.lisp stub module creation
- [x] T008 [P] Document current Stage 1 exports by running: wasm-tools print dist/clysm-stage1.wasm | grep export
- [x] T009 Identify function index allocation: FFI imports at 0-3, user exports at 4+

**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin

---

## Phase 3: User Story 1 & 4 - Stage 1 Compiler Export + Blocker Reporting (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP

**Goal**: Export compile_form from Stage 1 and implement blocker categorization for failed compilations

**Independent Test**: Load Stage 1 in Node.js, query exports, invoke compile_form with `(+ 1 2)`, verify valid Wasm output

### Tests for User Story 1 & 4 (TDD Required)

> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**

- [x] T010 [P] [US1] Contract test: Stage 1 exports compile_form in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-exports.lisp
- [x] T011 [P] [US1] Contract test: compile_form signature (anyref -> anyref) in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-signature.lisp
- [x] T012 [P] [US4] Contract test: blocker report JSON schema validation in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-blocker-report.lisp
- [x] T013 [US1] Integration test: compile simple form `(+ 1 2)` in tests/integration/bootstrap/test-compile-simple.js

### Implementation for User Story 1

- [x] T014 [US1] Modify src/clysm/stage1/generator.lisp to call generate-exports() from stage0
- [x] T015 [US1] Update export-section generation to include compile_form at index 4
- [x] T016 [US1] Update export-section generation to include compile_all at index 5
- [x] T017 [US1] Update export-section generation to include _initialize at index 6
- [x] T018 [US1] Wire compile_form export to bundled compiler function implementation
- [x] T019 [US1] Regenerate Stage 1: sbcl --load build/stage1-complete.lisp
- [x] T020 [US1] Verify exports: wasm-tools print dist/clysm-stage1.wasm | grep 'export.*compile_form'
- [x] T021 [US1] Update host-shim/stage1-runner.js to detect and report available exports

### Implementation for User Story 4 (Blocker Reporting)

- [ ] T022 [P] [US4] Create BlockerCategory struct in src/clysm/stage1/blocker.lisp
- [ ] T023 [P] [US4] Create BlockerReport struct in src/clysm/stage1/blocker.lisp
- [ ] T024 [US4] Implement categorize-error function to classify compilation failures
- [ ] T025 [US4] Implement aggregate-blockers function to group failures by category
- [ ] T026 [US4] Implement generate-blocker-report function with JSON output
- [ ] T027 [US4] Add remediation suggestions map in src/clysm/stage1/blocker.lisp
- [ ] T028 [US4] Integrate blocker reporting into Stage 1 compilation pipeline

**Checkpoint**: Stage 1 exports compile_form, blocker reports are categorized. Run T010-T013 tests to verify.

---

## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Stage 2 Generation (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Use Stage 1's compile_form to compile Clysm source into Stage 2 Wasm binary

**Independent Test**: Run stage2-gen.js, verify dist/clysm-stage2.wasm is created and passes validation

### Tests for User Story 2 (TDD Required)

- [ ] T029 [P] [US2] Contract test: Stage 2 generation script exits with code 0/1/2 in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-stage2-exit.js
- [ ] T030 [P] [US2] Contract test: Stage 2 output passes wasm-tools validate in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-stage2-valid.js
- [ ] T031 [US2] Integration test: full Stage 2 generation in tests/integration/bootstrap/test-stage2-gen.js

### Implementation for User Story 2

- [ ] T032 [US2] Create host-shim/stage2-gen.js with Stage 1 loader
- [ ] T033 [US2] Implement source file discovery (src/clysm/**/*.lisp in dependency order)
- [ ] T034 [US2] Implement form parser to extract defun/defmacro/defstruct forms
- [ ] T035 [US2] Implement compile_form invocation loop with error capture
- [ ] T036 [US2] Implement Wasm module aggregator to combine compiled forms
- [ ] T037 [US2] Add compilation statistics tracking (success/fail counts)
- [ ] T038 [US2] Generate dist/stage2-report.json with compilation results
- [ ] T039 [US2] Create scripts/run-stage2-gen.sh wrapper script
- [ ] T040 [US2] Verify Stage 2 output: wasm-tools validate dist/clysm-stage2.wasm

**Checkpoint**: Stage 2 generation completes (even with partial compilation). Run T029-T031 tests to verify.

---

## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Fixpoint Verification (Priority: P3)

**Goal**: Compare Stage 1 and Stage 2 for byte-identical match, report detailed diff if not

**Independent Test**: Run verify-fixpoint.sh with both binaries, get pass/fail result with diff details

### Tests for User Story 3 (TDD Required)

- [ ] T041 [P] [US3] Contract test: fixpoint script exit codes (0=identical, 1=differ) in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-fixpoint-exit.js
- [ ] T042 [P] [US3] Contract test: diff output format validation in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-diff-format.js
- [ ] T043 [US3] Integration test: full fixpoint verification in tests/integration/bootstrap/test-fixpoint.sh

### Implementation for User Story 3

- [ ] T044 [US3] Enhance scripts/verify-fixpoint.sh with size comparison
- [ ] T045 [US3] Add byte-level comparison using cmp command
- [ ] T046 [US3] Implement first-difference-offset reporting
- [ ] T047 [US3] Add section-level diff using wasm-tools objdump
- [ ] T048 [US3] Create FixpointResult JSON output format
- [ ] T049 [US3] Add --json flag for CI-friendly output
- [ ] T050 [US3] Handle edge cases: missing files, empty files, permission errors

**Checkpoint**: Fixpoint verification produces actionable comparison result. Run T041-T043 tests to verify.

---

## Phase 6: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns

**Purpose**: Improvements that affect multiple user stories

- [ ] T051 [P] Update CLAUDE.md with new commands and current status
- [ ] T052 [P] Add Phase 13D-9 entry to docs/features/COMPLETED-FEATURES.md
- [ ] T053 Run nix flake check to verify build integrity
- [ ] T054 [P] Add CI workflow step for fixpoint verification in .github/workflows/ (if exists)
- [ ] T055 Run quickstart.md validation end-to-end
- [ ] T056 [P] Cleanup: remove debug logging from production code
- [ ] T057 Final verification: regenerate Stage 1, generate Stage 2, run fixpoint check

---

## Dependencies & Execution Order

### Phase Dependencies

- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup completion - BLOCKS all user stories
- **User Stories 1 & 4 (Phase 3)**: Depends on Foundational - MVP milestone
- **User Story 2 (Phase 4)**: Depends on Phase 3 (needs compile_form export)
- **User Story 3 (Phase 5)**: Depends on Phase 4 (needs Stage 2 binary)
- **Polish (Phase 6)**: Depends on all user stories being complete

### User Story Dependencies

```
Phase 2 (Foundational)
        â”‚
        â–¼
Phase 3: US1 + US4 (Stage 1 Export + Blocker Reporting) â”€â”€â”
        â”‚                                                   â”‚
        â–¼                                                   â”‚
Phase 4: US2 (Stage 2 Generation) â—„â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
        â”‚                         (needs compile_form from US1)
        â–¼
Phase 5: US3 (Fixpoint Verification)
        â”‚   (needs Stage 2 from US2)
        â–¼
Phase 6: Polish
```

### Within Each User Story

1. Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation (TDD)
2. Contract tests before integration tests
3. Core implementation before integration points
4. Verification command before moving to next phase

### Parallel Opportunities

**Phase 1 (Setup)**:
- T002 and T003 can run in parallel

**Phase 3 (US1 + US4)**:
- T010, T011, T012 can run in parallel (different test files)
- T022, T023 can run in parallel (different structs)

**Phase 4 (US2)**:
- T029, T030 can run in parallel (different test files)

**Phase 5 (US3)**:
- T041, T042 can run in parallel (different test files)

**Phase 6 (Polish)**:
- T051, T052, T054, T056 can run in parallel (different files)

---

## Parallel Example: Phase 3 Tests

```bash
# Launch all contract tests for US1 + US4 together:
Task: "Contract test: Stage 1 exports compile_form in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-exports.lisp"
Task: "Contract test: compile_form signature in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-signature.lisp"
Task: "Contract test: blocker report JSON schema in tests/contract/fixpoint/test-blocker-report.lisp"
```

---

## Implementation Strategy

### MVP First (User Stories 1 & 4 Only)

1. Complete Phase 1: Setup
2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (CRITICAL - blocks all stories)
3. Complete Phase 3: User Stories 1 & 4
4. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Test compile_form export independently
5. Deploy/demo if ready - can already show compiler export capability

### Incremental Delivery

1. Complete Setup + Foundational â†’ Foundation ready
2. Add US1 + US4 â†’ Test independently â†’ **MVP: Compiler Export + Blocker Reports**
3. Add US2 â†’ Test independently â†’ **Self-hosting demo: Stage 2 generation**
4. Add US3 â†’ Test independently â†’ **Full feature: Fixpoint verification**
5. Each phase adds value without breaking previous phases

### Expected Outcomes by Phase

| Phase | Deliverable | Verification |
|-------|-------------|--------------|
| Phase 3 | compile_form exported | `wasm-tools print \| grep compile_form` |
| Phase 4 | Stage 2 binary | `wasm-tools validate dist/clysm-stage2.wasm` |
| Phase 5 | Fixpoint result | `./scripts/verify-fixpoint.sh` exits 0 or 1 |
| Phase 6 | Documentation | All tests pass, quickstart works |

---

## Notes

- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
- TDD is mandatory per Constitution Principle VII
- Each phase checkpoint verifies story independently
- Commit after each task or logical group
- Stop at any checkpoint to validate story independently
- Current compilation rate: 14.2% - expect many blocker reports initially
